The '''Drúedain of Númenor''' were the descendants of the [[First Age]] [[Drúedain of Beleriand|Drúedain]] survivors at the [[Havens of Sirion]] who were allowed to remove to the newly-made island of [[Elenna]] (i.e. [[Númenor]]) at the beginning of the [[Second Age]].<ref name=Drugu>{{UT|12c}}, note 7</ref>

Once settled in Númenor they thrived again and took no part in any wars.<ref name=Drugu/>

According to a copy of ''[[Aldarion and Erendis|The Mariner's Wife]]'', an old Númenórean story of some of their first voyages back to [[Middle-earth]] preserved in [[Gondor]], there was a note by the scribe which described the [[Drúedain]] of the household of [[Tar-Aldarion]] (the sixth [[King of Númenor]]) begging him to cease his voyages to Middle-earth, since they foreboded that evil would come of them.<ref group=note>Since the Drúedain were "ever noted for their strange [[foresight]]".</ref><ref name=Drugu/>

However, since they did not succeed in doing so, from then onwards the Drúedain began leaving Númenor for Middle-earth (despite their fear of the sea) until none were left at the island by the time [[Elendil]] escaped the [[Downfall of Númenor|Downfall]] in {{SA|3319}}<ref>{{App|SA}}, entry '''3319''', p. 1084</ref>.<ref name=Drugu/>

The last of them fled Númenor when [[Ar-Pharazôn]] brought [[Sauron]] there in {{SA|3262}}<ref>{{App|SA}}, entry '''3262''', p. 1084</ref>.<ref name=Drugu/>
